entry.title: Senior Project: Gathering Data
entry.summary:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*
* IPython notebook
*
*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */
.ansi-black-fg {
  color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-bg {
  background-color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-intense-fg {
  color: #282C36;
}
.ansi-black-intense-bg {
  background-color: #282C36;
}
.ansi-red-fg {
  color: #E75C58;
}
.ansi-red-bg {
  background-color: #E75C58;
}
.ansi-red-intense-fg {
  color: #B22B31;
}
.ansi-red-intense-bg {
  background-color: #B22B31;
}
.ansi-green-fg {
  color: #00A250;
}
.ansi-green-bg {
  background-color: #00A250;
}
.ansi-green-intense-fg {
  color: #007427;
}
.ansi-green-intense-bg {
  background-color: #007427;
}
.ansi-yellow-fg {
  color: #DDB62B;
}
.ansi-yellow-bg {
  background-color: #DDB62B;
}
.ansi-yellow-intense-fg {
  color: #B27D12;
}
.ansi-yellow-intense-bg {
  background-color: #B27D12;
}
.ansi-blue-fg {
  color: #208FFB;
}
.ansi-blue-bg {
  background-color: #208FFB;
}
.ansi-blue-intense-fg {
  color: #0065CA;
}
.ansi-blue-intense-bg {
  background-color: #0065CA;
}
.ansi-magenta-fg {
  color: #D160C4;
}
.ansi-magenta-bg {
  background-color: #D160C4;
}
.ansi-magenta-intense-fg {
  color: #A03196;
}
.ansi-magenta-intense-bg {
  background-color: #A03196;
}
.ansi-cyan-fg {
  color: #60C6C8;
}
.ansi-cyan-bg {
  background-color: #60C6C8;
}
.ansi-cyan-intense-fg {
  color: #258F8F;
}
.ansi-cyan-intense-bg {
  background-color: #258F8F;
}
.ansi-white-fg {
  color: #C5C1B4;
}
.ansi-white-bg {
  background-color: #C5C1B4;
}
.ansi-white-intense-fg {
  color: #A1A6B2;
}
.ansi-white-intense-bg {
  background-color: #A1A6B2;
}
.ansi-default-inverse-fg {
  color: #FFFFFF;
}
.ansi-default-inverse-bg {
  background-color: #000000;
}
.ansi-bold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
.ansi-underline {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
/* The following styles are deprecated an will be removed in a future version */
.ansibold {
  font-weight: bold;
}
.ansi-inverse {
  outline: 0.5px dotted;
}
/* use dark versions for foreground, to improve visibility */
.ansiblack {
  color: black;
}
.ansired {
  color: darkred;
}
.ansigreen {
  color: darkgreen;
}
.ansiyellow {
  color: #c4a000;
}
.ansiblue {
  color: darkblue;
}
.ansipurple {
  color: darkviolet;
}
.ansicyan {
  color: steelblue;
}
.ansigray {
  color: gray;
}
/* and light for background, for the same reason */
.ansibgblack {
  background-color: black;
}
.ansibgred {
  background-color: red;
}
.ansibggreen {
  background-color: green;
}
.ansibgyellow {
  background-color: yellow;
}
.ansibgblue {
  background-color: blue;
}
.ansibgpurple {
  background-color: magenta;
}
.ansibgcyan {
  background-color: cyan;
}
.ansibggray {
  background-color: gray;
}
div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
/*

Original style from softwaremaniacs.org (c) Ivan Sagalaev <Maniac@SoftwareManiacs.Org>
Adapted from GitHub theme

*/
.highlight-base {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable {
  color: #000;
}
.highlight-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.highlight-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}
.highlight-string {
  color: #BA2121;
}
.highlight-comment {
  color: #408080;
  font-style: italic;
}
.highlight-number {
  color: #080;
}
.highlight-atom {
  color: #88F;
}
.highlight-keyword {
  color: #008000;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-builtin {
  color: #008000;
}
.highlight-error {
  color: #f00;
}
.highlight-operator {
  color: #AA22FF;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.highlight-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
/* previously not defined, copying from default codemirror */
.highlight-def {
  color: #00f;
}
.highlight-string-2 {
  color: #f50;
}
.highlight-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.highlight-bracket {
  color: #997;
}
.highlight-tag {
  color: #170;
}
.highlight-attribute {
  color: #00c;
}
.highlight-header {
  color: blue;
}
.highlight-quote {
  color: #090;
}
.highlight-link {
  color: #00c;
}
/* apply the same style to codemirror */
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-keyword {
  color: #008000;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-atom {
  color: #88F;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-number {
  color: #080;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-def {
  color: #00f;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-variable {
  color: #000;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-operator {
  color: #AA22FF;
  font-weight: bold;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-variable-2 {
  color: #1a1a1a;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-variable-3 {
  color: #333333;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-comment {
  color: #408080;
  font-style: italic;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-string {
  color: #BA2121;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-string-2 {
  color: #f50;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-meta {
  color: #AA22FF;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-qualifier {
  color: #555;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-builtin {
  color: #008000;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-bracket {
  color: #997;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-tag {
  color: #170;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-attribute {
  color: #00c;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-header {
  color: blue;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-quote {
  color: #090;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-link {
  color: #00c;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-error {
  color: #f00;
}
.cm-s-ipython span.cm-tab {
  background: url(data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAADAAAAAMCAYAAAAkuj5RAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAGFJREFUSMft1LsRQFAQheHPowAKoACx3IgEKtaEHujDjORSgWTH/ZOdnZOcM/sgk/kFFWY0qV8foQwS4MKBCS3qR6ixBJvElOobYAtivseIE120FaowJPN75GMu8j/LfMwNjh4HUpwg4LUAAAAASUVORK5CYII=);
  background-position: right;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}

  margin-top: 1em;

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Gathering-Data">Gathering Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Gathering-Data">¶</a></h1><p>The crucial part to my thesis is to have a viable data set to work with. In this particular case, the data set is tweets to run through a sentiment analyzer. Builing the data set has two parts:</p>
<ol>
<li>Creating a twitter stream</li>
<li>Building a databse of tweets fromt the stream</li>
</ol>
<p>I ran both the stream and the database on a remote vm running Ubuntu Server 16.04</p>
<h2 id="Building-a-Twitter-Stream">Building a Twitter Stream<a class="anchor-link" href="#Building-a-Twitter-Stream">¶</a></h2><p>Twitter has a cap on the number of historical tweets you can pull, and it's search function automatically promotes the tweets that are higher ranked. On the other hand, the stream will gather all tweets with the keywords you're interested in regardless of interaction, popularity, etc.</p>
<h3 id="Setup">Setup<a class="anchor-link" href="#Setup">¶</a></h3><p>I ran the steram and the database on a remote server, but the same setup can be used locally given you're working on a UNIX system. Packages your computer will need:</p>
<ul>
<li>python3</li>
<li>python3-pip</li>
</ul>
<p>I used Twitter's API <a href="http://docs.tweepy.org/en/v3.5.0/index.html">Tweepy</a>. You can use pip to install it for python use.</p>
<p>Besides installing Tweepy, I needed to register myself as a Twitter Developer and create an application. The application provides me with an API key which then allows me to make a call to build my stream. You can register as a developer and</p>
<h3 id="Running-The-Stream:">Running The Stream:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Running-The-Stream:">¶</a></h3><p>This is the code to run a stream:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Stream</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">OAuthHandler</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy.streaming</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">StreamListener</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">json</span>

<span class="n">ckey</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"pF5W6BaHFteEYdkq38cgZ755g"</span>
<span class="n">csecret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"AwnBHQTmvVr6cMSYKm89vQOXMO3sPyoGvhXMaow3zlg2G74vLq"</span>
<span class="n">atoken</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"2646419088-gtzEn525GUUtTlwpegdZGd8dGLWl8m2IGq9jk9y"</span>
<span class="n">asecret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"iQbg8ZfJ8KkI06n0lwkCVVprtkzsIp6h1RMXP5LN3Z6o2"</span>

<span class="n">keywords</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"#ThanksgivingFootball"</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">StreamListener</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">StreamListener</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1">#This is a class provided by tweepy to access the Twitter Streaming API.</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_connect</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1"># Called initially to connect to the Streaming API</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You are now connected to the streaming API."</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_error</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">status_code</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1"># On error - if an error occurs, display the error / status code</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'An Error has occured: '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">repr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">status_code</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1">#This is the meat of the script...it connects to your mongoDB and stores the tweet</span>
        <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="c1"># Decode the JSON from Twitter</span>
            <span class="n">datajson</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loads</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">)</span>

            <span class="c1">#grab the 'created_at' data from the Tweet to use for display</span>
            <span class="n">created_at</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datajson</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'created_at'</span><span class="p">]</span>

            <span class="c1">#print out a message to the screen that we have collected a tweet</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Tweet collected at "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">created_at</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">" "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">datajson</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'text'</span><span class="p">])</span>

        <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">Exception</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">e</span><span class="p">:</span>
           <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">e</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">auth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">OAuthHandler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ckey</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">csecret</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_access_token</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">atoken</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">asecret</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">keywords</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"#midterms"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#vote"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#bluewave"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#redwave"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#democrats"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#elections"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#gop"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#usa"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">twitterStream</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Stream</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auth</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">StreamListener</span><span class="p">())</span>
<span class="n">twitterStream</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">track</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The code is source from the tweepy documentation found. I worked off a baseline, and do any actual tweet manipulation-like insterting them into a database-in the on_data function. The data variable is a dictionary, which stores the tweet itself along with various other metrics</p>
<p>The keywords that the filter is listening for are in the keywords list. If the keywords are separated by commas, the filter will find tweets containing keyword1 OR keyword2. If they're separated by a space, the filter will find tweets with keyword1 AND keyword 2.</p>
<p>Right now, the tweets are just being printed on the console. The next part is building the database to store the streamed tweets.</p>
<h2 id="Building-the-Database">Building the Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#Building-the-Database">¶</a></h2><p>I decided to use mongodb to store my tweets. Converting the tweets from dictionary to json is simple in Python, and it's then easy to stuff in a mongodb database.</p>
<h3 id="Setup">Setup<a class="anchor-link" href="#Setup">¶</a></h3><p>To set up mongo on your server, follow the instructions for your operating system <a href="https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/administration/install-community/">here</a>. Use pip to install the pymongo client.</p>
<p>To get ready to stream start the mongod daemon with the command <code>mongod</code>.</p>
<h3 id="Inserting-Tweets-to-Database">Inserting Tweets to Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#Inserting-Tweets-to-Database">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Stream</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">OAuthHandler</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tweepy.streaming</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">StreamListener</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">pymongo</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">MongoClient</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">json</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">sys</span>



<span class="n">MONGO_HOST</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'mongodb://localhost/miscdb'</span>  <span class="c1"># assuming you have mongoDB installed locally</span>
                                             <span class="c1"># and a database called 'twitterdb'</span>
<span class="n">ckey</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"pF5W6BaHFteEYdkq38cgZ755g"</span>
<span class="n">csecret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"AwnBHQTmvVr6cMSYKm89vQOXMO3sPyoGvhXMaow3zlg2G74vLq"</span>
<span class="n">atoken</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"2646419088-gtzEn525GUUtTlwpegdZGd8dGLWl8m2IGq9jk9y"</span>
<span class="n">asecret</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"iQbg8ZfJ8KkI06n0lwkCVVprtkzsIp6h1RMXP5LN3Z6o2"</span>

<span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">StreamListener</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">StreamListener</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1">#This is a class provided by tweepy to access the Twitter Streaming API.</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_connect</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1"># Called initially to connect to the Streaming API</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"You are now connected to the streaming API."</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_error</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">status_code</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1"># On error - if an error occurs, display the error / status code</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'An Error has occured: '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">repr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">status_code</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">on_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="c1">#This is the meat of the script...it connects to your mongoDB and stores the tweet</span>
        <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">client</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">MongoClient</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">MONGO_HOST</span><span class="p">)</span>

            <span class="c1"># Use twitterdb database. If it doesn't exist, it will be created.</span>
            <span class="n">db</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">client</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">miscdb</span>

            <span class="c1"># Decode the JSON from Twitter</span>
            <span class="n">datajson</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loads</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">)</span>

            <span class="c1">#grab the 'created_at' data from the Tweet to use for display</span>
            <span class="n">created_at</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datajson</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'created_at'</span><span class="p">]</span>

            <span class="c1">#print out a message to the screen that we have collected a tweet</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Tweet collected at "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">created_at</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">" "</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">datajson</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'text'</span><span class="p">])</span>

            <span class="c1">#insert the data into the mongoDB into a collection called twitter_search</span>
            <span class="c1">#if twitter_search doesn't exist, it will be created.</span>
            <span class="n">db</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">misc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">insert</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">datajson</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">Exception</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">e</span><span class="p">:</span>
           <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">e</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">auth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">OAuthHandler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ckey</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">csecret</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_access_token</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">atoken</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">asecret</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#input = input("Which districts would you like to observe? Please separate districts by a comma")</span>
<span class="c1">#keywords = list(input.split(','))</span>
<span class="c1">#keywords = ["Antonio Delgado", "John Faso", "NY19", "@DelgadoforNY19", "@RepJohnFaso"]</span>
<span class="n">keywords</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"#midterms"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#vote"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#bluewave"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#redwave"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#democrats"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#elections"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#gop"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"#usa"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">twitterStream</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Stream</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">auth</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">StreamListener</span><span class="p">())</span>
<span class="n">twitterStream</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">track</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In some cases - hosting your database on a different server - the mongo database will be on the local host. Like I mentioned earlier, the database insertion happens in the on_data function.</p>
<p>The pymongo client is initialized with the mongo host. The line <code>db = client.miscdb</code> declares the specific database for the tweets. If miscdb doesn't exist, the mongod deamon will create the database for you. Make sure that the database name here matches the database name outlined in MONGO_HOST. Last, the tweet is inserted into a collection <code>misc</code>. Like with the database, if the collection doesn't exist, it's created.</p>
<p>The above code will collect and store tweets of keywords you choose. Make sure that the mongod daemon is running.</p>
<h3 id="Explore-Your-Database">Explore Your Database<a class="anchor-link" href="#Explore-Your-Database">¶</a></h3><p>I wanted to see the tweets I had collected. To do that, I used the mongo shell.</p>
<p>Once the mongod daemon is running, you can start the shell using the command <code>mongo</code>. To see all databases on the server, use the command <code>show dbs</code>. If the stream worked, the db you created will be listed. To see specific stats, switch the said database using <code>use <dbname></code>. Then, use <code>db.stats()</code>. The command will show you a variety of stats including total items in the database.</p>
<p>To see specific tweets, use the find command. To list all tweets, <code>db.<collection_name>.find()</code> will work. To find specific tweets, the search parameter will go in the parentheses.</p>
<h2 id="Ensuring-the-Stream-Doesn't-Time-Out">Ensuring the Stream Doesn't Time Out<a class="anchor-link" href="#Ensuring-the-Stream-Doesn't-Time-Out">¶</a></h2><p>Both Python and Mongod will time out. Since I was collecting tweets over weeks at a time, it was irritating to repeatedly check on the stream to see if it needed to be restarted.</p>
<p>Mongod:
<code>mongod --fork --logpath /var/log/mongod.log</code></p>
<p>Python:
<code>setsid python3 <path_to_file> < /dev/zero &> log.txt &</code></p>
<p>To ensure the scripts are running, use the command <code>ps -aux | grep python</code>. If running, the scripts will be listed in the output. To know that the mongod server is still running, try running mongo. If the connection is refused, it's a sign that the mongod daemon isn't running.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span> 
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {

}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {

}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {

}
p.p-space {

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="The-Senior-Project">The Senior Project<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-Senior-Project">¶</a></h1><p>The senior project is the culmination of my undergraduate career. It's a year-long exploration into a topic or idea, and gives students a taste of undergraduate research. I personally, am exploring the relationship twitter sentiment and voting trends:</p>
<h1 id="Political-Polling">Political Polling<a class="anchor-link" href="#Political-Polling">¶</a></h1><p>Polling is a key part of every political campaign. The basic intent is to find out how many people prefer a certain candidate. More complex polls ask questions hoping to profile the voter. Candidates use polls and the profiles polls generate to make key campaign decisions.</p>
<p>Most pollsters use phone banking to gather information, but use different questions to create different polling models. There’s reason to believe that this method may not present the complete picture it once did due to several factors - <a href="https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nhis/earlyrelease/wireless201705.pdf">less landline usage</a>, a <a href="http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2018/04/03/millennials-approach-baby-boomers-as-largest-generation-in-u-s-electorate/">younger and more active electorate</a>, and the <a href="http://files.shareholder.com/downloads/AMDA-2F526X/6351299748x0x982956/287E1B9D-2342-4735-9A8E-D0DA7A614CB1/Q2_2018_Slide_Presentation.pdf">rise of social media</a>. Social media especially presents opinions from a different audience than the traditional pollster reaches.</p>
<h1 id="Twitter-and-Sentiment-Analysis">Twitter and Sentiment Analysis<a class="anchor-link" href="#Twitter-and-Sentiment-Analysis">¶</a></h1><p>Twitter started as a microblogging platform in 2006. Users on Twitter post tweets, which are limited to 280 characters. Posts on twitter widely vary in topic, creating a unique network, referred to colloquially as the Twittersphere.</p>
<p>Social media has become an important forum for political discourse, and Twitter has been no exception. Notably, President Trump uses Twitter for official White House business and used it extensively during his campaign.</p>
<p>Twitter’s low threshold for posting and short posts result in Tweets that offer honest opinions. These opinions are a good look into reaction and thoughts of a large population. With over 500 million tweets a day, it’s impossible for a single human or even a group of human to comb through each tweet. But with the Twitter API, it’s possible to process the vast number of tweets that a human can’t.</p>
<p>Traditionally, computers could log keywords, figure out word usage, and generally log quantitative information about text. To process opinions, it’s important to interpret qualitative information from the tweet like intent, support, etc. I will use sentiment analysis, a natural language processing technique to read positive, negative, or neutral sentiment.</p>
<p>With the source of information and the tools available it is feasible to evaluate large portions of the opinions available on social media.</p>
<h1 id="My-Proposed-Process">My Proposed Process<a class="anchor-link" href="#My-Proposed-Process">¶</a></h1><p>The process will happen in three steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Building a tweet streamer to “listen” to tweets based on keyword</li>
<li>Running sentiment analysis on the tweets that are scraped</li>
<li>Using sentiment and keywords to draw correlation with voting tendencies</li>
</ol>
<p>The data collection process:
<img src = "data_collection.png">
There are two ways to access tweets by people. The first is to “scrape” twitter.com, which means to access the website and physically copy the tweets seen. It’s a method that’s inefficient and tiresome. The second is to use the Twitter API and build a stream that listens to tweets with certain keywords. The stream will load tweets into a database and create a permanent data set test and analyze throughout the year.</p>
<p>The midterm elections are on November 6th and the window to collect tweets is small. It’s important to build a scalable pipeline to collect tweets by October 1st, and then collect a month of data before the elections themselves.</p>
<p>Sentiment analysis is a machine learning process that picks out keywords to read intent behind a statement. Each statement can be evaluated to have a negative, neutral, or positive sentiment.</p>
<p>There are a variety of sentiment analysis tools available on the internet. Both Amazon’s AWS and Microsoft’s Azure have one. As of right now, I’m interested in using a tool VADER, which is built specifically for social media. VADER is able to recognize emoji’s as well as balance multiple expressed sentiments in a single piece of text.</p>
<p>From the analyzed texts, we can draw correlations between sentiment about topics and voting patterns and public polling. The overarching goal of the project is to aid conventional pollsters by providing information from a different information source.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}





.rendered_html pre,




.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,


.rendered_html tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #f5f5f5;
}
.rendered_html tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(66, 165, 245, 0.2);
}
.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,


.rendered_html * + .alert {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
[dir="rtl"] 
div.text_cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.text_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.text_cell_render {
  /*font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, sans-serif;*/
  outline: none;
  resize: none;
  width: inherit;
  border-style: none;
  padding: 0.5em 0.5em 0.5em 0.4em;
  color: #000;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
}
a.anchor-link:link {
  text-decoration: none;
  padding: 0px 20px;
  visibility: hidden;
}
h1:hover .anchor-link,
h2:hover .anchor-link,
h3:hover .anchor-link,
h4:hover .anchor-link,
h5:hover .anchor-link,
h6:hover .anchor-link {
  visibility: visible;
}
.text_cell.rendered .input_area {
  display: none;
}
.text_cell.rendered 
.text_cell.rendered .rendered_html tr,
.text_cell.rendered .rendered_html th,
.text_cell.rendered 
.text_cell.unrendered .text_cell_render {
  display: none;
}
.text_cell .dropzone .input_area {
  border: 2px dashed #bababa;
  margin: -1px;
}
.cm-header-1,
.cm-header-2,
.cm-header-3,
.cm-header-4,
.cm-header-5,
.cm-header-6 {
  font-weight: bold;
  font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
}
.cm-header-1 {
  font-size: 185.7%;
}
.cm-header-2 {
  font-size: 157.1%;
}
.cm-header-3 {
  font-size: 128.6%;
}
.cm-header-4 {
  font-size: 110%;
}
.cm-header-5 {
  font-size: 100%;
  font-style: italic;
}
.cm-header-6 {
  font-size: 100%;
  font-style: italic;
}
</style>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Portfolio">Portfolio<a class="anchor-link" href="#Portfolio">¶</a></h1><p>Over the last three summers between courses, internships, and research experiences, I've assembled a portfolio of writings and projects.</p>
<h2 id="Published-Writings/Visuals">Published Writings/Visuals<a class="anchor-link" href="#Published-Writings/Visuals">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Alpaca">Alpaca<a class="anchor-link" href="#Alpaca">¶</a></h3><p>In summer 2018, I worked for <a href="https://aplaca.markets">Alpaca</a>, a fintech startup in San Mateo. I worked on building a simple robo advisor. Alongside, I started writing through the Alpaca account on my project as well as about algo trading in general.</p>
<ol>
<li><a href="https://hackernoon.com/9-great-tools-for-algo-trading-e0938a6856cd">9 Great Tools For Algo Trading</a> A list of backtesters, data providers, and web services for algo traders</li>
<li><a href="https://hackernoon.com/i-am-a-college-student-and-i-built-my-own-robo-advisor-3f31b39dab50">I'm a College Student and I Built My Own Robo Advisor</a> A breakdown of the process I used to build my robo advisor on Quantopian's online IDE.</li>
<li><a href="https://hackernoon.com/im-a-college-student-and-i-m-still-building-my-robo-advisor-928110fe5bf1">I'm a College Student and I'm Still Building My Robo Advisor</a> Part 2 of my robo advisor writing. I moved the robo advisor off of Quantopians online IDE and onto their offline backtester Zipline, and expanded the universe of symbols the robo advisor handled.</li>
<li><a href="https://hackernoon.com/data-data-data-11-great-financial-data-vendors-844d2cfce77d">11 Financial Data Vendors</a> An article that covers the various levels of data vendors available for an algo trader. </li>
</ol>
<h3 id="The-Center-for-the-Study-of-the-Drone">The Center for the Study of the Drone<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-Center-for-the-Study-of-the-Drone">¶</a></h3><p>In the summer of 2015, I worked as a research assisstant for the <a href="http://dronecenter.bard.edu/">Bard College Center for the Study of the Drone</a>. I contributed to the Center's database of FAA commercial exemptions for drone use. Building off of the exemption base, I created several geographic visuals. Both the database and the visuals were published on the Verge.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://dronecenter.bard.edu/the-exemptions-database/">Database</a></li>
<li><a href="http://dronecenter.bard.edu/mapping-the-drone-industry/">Visuals</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 id="GitHub-Repositories">GitHub Repositories<a class="anchor-link" href="#GitHub-Repositories">¶</a></h2><h3 id="Classwork">Classwork<a class="anchor-link" href="#Classwork">¶</a></h3><p>The following repositories are all for various courses from school:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/Machine-Learning-F18">Machine-Learning-F18</a>: Machine Learning takein in the fall of 2018. Covered decision trees, neural networks, supervised/unsupervised learning, regression analysis. All code is (currently) in Python</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/BioInformatics">BioInformatics</a>: Programming in Biology taken in the spring of 2018. Covered various statistical concepts such as classification, image processing, etc. with a biological slant. My final project was building a classifier for breast cancer cell lines</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/Classifying-Cancer">Classifying Cancer</a>: An in-progress extension of the final to add a web interface to my final project using Heroku. </li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/Fantasy-Baseball-Helper">Fantasy-Baseball-Helper</a>: The final project from Object-Oriented-Programming. Forms fantasy baseball team based on team-building criteria. </li>
</ul>
<h3 id="42">42<a class="anchor-link" href="#42">¶</a></h3><p>During my time off of school, I spent about 4-5 months at 42 Silicon Valley. Started originally by Xavier Niel, 42 is a tuition-free coding academy provided you pass their entrance exams. It's a project-based curriculum.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/42-piscine">42-piscine</a>: The piscine is an intensive 4 week test period with daily coding exercises in C.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/libft">libft</a>: A library of function written in C. Some functions are original, and other functions are recreations of existing functions such as strcpy, strlen, etc. </li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/FdF">FdF</a>: A graphics project creating 3D wireframe images from integer maps in text files</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/raovinnakota/fract-ol">Fract-ol</a>: Another graphics project that recreated famous fractal images such as the Serpienski Carpet, Julia Set, and Mandelbrot set. </li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}
